result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Muhamed Memo Memic

defendant.name: Memic, Muhamed Memo
defendant.address: 3008 Eldrado Blvd Apt 1, Eau Claire, WI 53719

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Defendant Muhamed Memo Memic appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Muhamed Memo Memic.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Def appearing from Barron County Jail; def waives in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Otten crosses.  No redirect.  Witness steps down.  Atty Schmidt argues for bind-over.  Attorney Otten argues against bind-over.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State efiles information mirroring complaint.  Atty Otten preserves on motion until next status conference; granted.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.   Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:17 PM Defendant Muhamed Memo Memic appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Muhamed Memo Memic.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Def appearing from Barron County Jail.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. NG pleas entered to misdemeanors.  Atty Otten wishes to address bond, has filed a motion; Court will hear motion.  Atty Otten argues in support of her motion to modify bond to signature bond.  ADA Schmidt argues against modification of bond.  Court denies bond modification.  Prelim wanted within time limits.  State requests to appear by Zoom; no objection from def.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:06 PM Defendant Muhamed Memo Memic appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Muhamed Memo Memic.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Def appears in custody from Barron County Jail.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Atty Otten requests adjournment.  Defense will be heard on bond on the 10/12/22 date.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant must be truthful with law enforcement.

No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
